description:
Erection of a three-storey building providing 4 x 2 bedroom
single family dwellings with integral garages, as a
variation to planning permission ref PEX0101033R2 dated 27/
11/02 for the erection of a three-storey building providing
4 x 2 bedroom single family dwellings
as shown on drawing numbers PL13-106, 105, 104, 101, 100,
102, 103.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The details of the [layout, sections, elevations and facing materials] to be used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. [Such details shall include proposed slab levels of the building in relation to the existing and proposed levels of the site and the surrounding land.] These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 2 - Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order, no development within Part 1 (Classes A-H) of Schedule 2 of that Order shall be carried out without the grant of planning permission having first been obtained from the Council.

Condition : 3 - All fenestration must be retained as shown in the approved
    drawings, i.e. as either translucent or obscure glazing.

Condition : 4 - The internal garages must be provided and retained for car
    parking use and shall not be converted into habitable rooms
    without the prior approval in writing from the Council.

Condition : 5 - All rooflights in the rear roofslope hereby approved, shall
    contain obscure glazing, and the rooflights serving the
    internal staircases shall be permanently fixed shut.

Condition : 6 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN14 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 7 - To safeguard the visual amenities of the area as well as
    adjoining occupiers amenities and to prevent over
    development of the site by controlling proposed extensions
    and alterations in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of policies EN1,  EN19, EN22 and EN24  of the
    London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 8 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN13 and EN14 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 9 - To ensure that internal parking spaces are provided and
    retained as such so that on street parking pressure is not
    increased, in accordance with the requirements of policies
    TR11 and TR17 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 10 - To safeguard the residential amenity of adjacent occupiers
    in accordance with policies EN1 and EN19 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 11 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not take
    place other than between the hours of 08.00am to 18.00 pm on
    Monday to Friday and 08.00am to 13.00pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.

Condition : 12 - The correct street number or number and name must be
    displayed permanently on the premises in accordance with
    regulations made under Section 12 of the London Building
    (Amendments) Act 1939 (IH07)

Condition : 13 - Your proposals may be subject to control under the Building
    Act 1984, the Building Regulations and the London Building
    Acts: 1930-82, and you are advised to consult the Council's
    Streets Management Building Control Service, located at
    Camden Town Hall Argyle Street, WC1H 8EQ. (Tel: 020 7974
    6941)
